meanings.definition: A player in American and Canadian football who typically lines up directly behind the center and is responsible for calling plays and passing or handing off the ball.
meanings.sent1: The quarterback threw a long pass to the wide receiver.
meanings.sent2: The quarterback led the team to victory with his accurate throws.
meanings.sent3: The quarterback's pass was so high, it almost touched the clouds!
meanings.sent4: She was the quarterback of the debate team, guiding her teammates to success.
meanings.sent5: The quarterback's role is crucial in determining the team's success on the field.

meanings.definition: To act as a quarterback in a game or situation.
meanings.sent1: He will quarterback the team in the championship game.
meanings.sent2: She quarterbacked the group project, ensuring everyone knew their roles.
meanings.sent3: I will quarterback the plan to surprise our friends at the party.
meanings.sent4: The coach asked him to quarterback the new marketing campaign.
meanings.sent5: She quarterbacked the meeting, making sure all ideas were heard and discussed.
